page.title: 18An interview with R.M.Owen
page.content: We asked R.M.Owen,retired headmaster and local historian about changes he has seen in our area in :- {Education:}Selection testing abolished and secondary education now organised on Comprehensive lines.Primary schools re-housed in modern buildings. {The Castle:}Once swings etc. were pro- -vided and children played there.Con- ducted tours now form the main{tourist attraction,plus{Cadw's}planned events. { The Hospital:}In the treatment of in- -mates the emphasis was previously one of containment. Nurses were known as {keepers,}all wards were locked and discipline was severe. Nowadays a more sympathetic approach allows most of the patients more freedom. { The Railway:}'Beeching' cuts in 60's led to the end of this form of trans- -port.A valuable facility was lost and the volume of road traffic increased.
